page.title: 09Crematorium St.Helens
page.content: The cemetary was opened in 1858 and the {crematorium }was opened in 1962. There is room to expand until the mid 1990,s. The {crematorium} is more popular but that has not always been true. Two to three people get buried a day on average but seven a day get { {cremated} on average. There are three chapels there but only one is now used. They rarely have trouble with vandalism. St.Thomas's Well is supposed to cure blindness. The oldest grave is 1857 20 November, and the person was {Marian Shanks.}The cost to be buried, if you live in St.Helens is Â£59 but if you live outside St.Helens it is Â£118. To { {cremate someone,}if you live in St.Helens costs Â£46 but if you live outside St.Helens it costs Â£69. When the {cemetary}first opened to be buried cost Â£9.
